intro: Primula aliciae, commonly known as the Alice's primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
